   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;
   239â†’  electronMcpEnabled: boolean;
   240â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: boolean;
   241â†’  graphitiEnabled: boolean;
   242â†’
   243â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   244â†’  agentMcpOverrides?: {
   245â†’    [agentType: string]: {
   246â†’      add?: string[];
   247â†’      remove?: string[];
   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file
   271â†’

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 1_6 Complete: Database Migrations Generated and Applied

The database migration subtask has been **successfully completed**! Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ¯ Migration Applied
- **Migration File**: `20260105203016_add_auto_claude_support`
- **Status**: Successfully applied to database
- **Confirmation**: `npx prisma migrate status` shows "Database schema is up to date!"

### ğŸ“Š Database Schema Changes
1. **Settings Table Created**:
   - `id` (TEXT PRIMARY KEY)
   - `key` (TEXT UNIQUE) 
   - `value` (TEXT)
   - `encrypted` (BOOLEAN DEFAULT false)
   - `createdAt`, `updatedAt` (DATETIME)

2. **Project Model Extended** with Auto-Claude fields:
   - `autoClaudeEnabled` (BOOLEAN DEFAULT false)
   - `autoClaudeConfigId` (TEXT nullable)
   - `modelProfileId` (TEXT nullable) 
   - `lastAutoClaudeSync` (DATETIME nullable)

3. **Proper Constraints**:
   - Unique index on `Settings.key`
   - Foreign key constraints maintained
   - Cascade delete rules preserved

### âœ¨ Phase 1 Complete!
The entire **"Schema & Types (Foundation)"** phase is now complete (6/6 subtasks):
- âœ… Auto-Claude TypeScript interfaces
- âœ… Zod validation schemas  
- âœ… Settings model added
- âœ… ComponentType enum extended
- âœ… Project model extended
- âœ… **Database migrations applied**

### ğŸš€ Ready for Phase 2
The foundation is now solid and ready for the next phase: **"Settings Infrastructure"** which will implement the encryption utilities and settings service layer.

The database is properly prepared to support the full Auto-Claude integration with secure credential storage and project-level Auto-Claude configuration tracking.
I'll help you implement the encrypt/decrypt functions using Node.js crypto module with AES-256-GCM. Let me start by getting the current build context and understanding the project structure.

entries.detail:
1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚

    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE

   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";

   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 2_1 Completed Successfully!

I have successfully implemented the encryption utility with AES-256-GCM as required. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ” **Implementation Details**

**Created:** `packages/server/src/lib/encryption.ts`

**Key Features:**
- **AES-256-GCM Encryption**: Industry-standard authenticated encryption
- **Secure Key Derivation**: Uses scrypt with random salts for key generation
- **Random IV Generation**: Each encryption uses a unique initialization vector
- **Authentication Tags**: GCM mode provides built-in authentication
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive error handling with descriptive messages

### ğŸ“‹ **Functions Implemented**

1. **`encrypt(plaintext: string)`**: Encrypts text and returns base64-encoded string
2. **`decrypt(encryptedData: string)`**: Decrypts base64-encoded encrypted data
3. **`isEncrypted(value: string)`**: Utility to detect if a string appears encrypted
4. **`testEncryption()`**: Self-test function for validation

### ğŸ”§ **Technical Specifications**

- **Algorithm**: AES-256-GCM
- **Key Length**: 256 bits (32 bytes)
- **IV Length**: 128 bits (16 bytes)
- **Salt Length**: 256 bits (32 bytes)
- **Tag Length**: 128 bits (16 bytes)
- **Key Derivation**: scrypt with random salt

### ğŸŒ **Environment Requirements**

The utility requires the `CCM_ENCRYPTION_KEY` environment variable to be set for secure operation.

### âœ… **Testing Results**

- âœ… Basic encryption/decryption cycle test passed

1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚

    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚
    92â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Settings            â”‚    â”‚

    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚

   102â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ apps/backend/prompts/*.md      â”‚
   103â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ [AGENT_CONFIGS from CCM API]   â”‚
   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚
   105â†’â”‚   Per-Project:                      â”‚
   106â†’â”‚  .auto-claude/                      â”‚
   107â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ .env                           â”‚
   108â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ task_metadata.json             â”‚
   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;
   239â†’  electronMcpEnabled: boolean;
   240â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: boolean;
   241â†’  graphitiEnabled: boolean;
   242â†’
   243â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   244â†’  agentMcpOverrides?: {
   245â†’    [agentType: string]: {
   246â†’      add?: string[];
   247â†’      remove?: string[];
   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file
   271â†’
   272â†’---
   273â†’
   274â†’## Database Schema
   275â†’

   277â†’
   278â†’**Settings Table:**
   279â†’```prisma

   281â†’  id        String   @id @default(cuid())

   285â†’  createdAt DateTime @default(now())
   286â†’  updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt
   287â†’}
   288â†’```
   289â†’
   290â†’**Settings Keys:**
   291â†’- `autoClaudeBackendPath`: Path to Auto-Claude installation
   292â†’- `linearApiKey`: (encrypted) Linear API key

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 2_1 Complete: Encryption Utility Implementation

I have successfully completed the implementation of encrypt/decrypt functions using Node.js crypto module with AES-256-GCM. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ” **Encryption Implementation Features**

**Core Functionality:**
- âœ… **AES-256-GCM encryption** - Industry-standard authenticated encryption
- âœ… **Secure key derivation** - Using scrypt with random 256-bit salts
- âœ… **Random IV generation** - 128-bit initialization vector per operation
- âœ… **Authentication tags** - 128-bit GCM tags for integrity verification
- âœ… **Base64 encoding** - Safe storage and transmission format

**Security Best Practices:**
- âœ… **Password-based encryption** - Uses CCM_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable
- âœ… **Salt per encryption** - Prevents rainbow table attacks
- âœ… **IV per encryption** - Ensures unique ciphertext even for identical plaintext
- âœ… **Authenticated encryption** - Detects tampering through authentication tags

**Utility Functions:**
- âœ… **`encrypt(plaintext)`** - Encrypts string data to base64
- âœ… **`decrypt(encryptedData)`** - Decrypts base64 data to original string
- âœ… **`isEncrypted(value)`** - Heuristic detection of encrypted strings
- âœ… **`testEncryption()`** - Built-in validation function

**Error Handling:**
- âœ… **Comprehensive error messages** - Clear indication of failure reasons
- âœ… **Input validation** - Checks for sufficient data length
- âœ… **Environment validation** - Ensures encryption key is available

### ğŸ§ª **Testing Verification**

All tests passed successfully:
- âœ… **Basic encryption test** - Built-in round-trip validation
- âœ… **Specific data encryption** - API key-like data with special characters
- âœ… **Encryption detection** - Correctly identifies encrypted vs plain text
- âœ… **Error handling** - Proper error throwing for invalid input

### ğŸ“ **Files Updated**

- **`packages/server/src/lib/encryption.ts`** - Complete encryption utility implementation
- **`.auto-claude/specs/001-ccm-auto-claude-integration/build-progress.txt`** - Updated progress tracking

### ğŸ¯ **Next Steps**

The project is now ready for **Subtask 2_2: Implement settings service** which will:
- Create service layer for settings CRUD operations
- Use the encryption utility for sensitive data (API keys)
- Provide automatic encryption/decryption based on key patterns

**Status**: Phase 1 Complete âœ… | Phase 2 Settings Infrastructure (1/4 subtasks complete) ğŸš§
I'll help you implement the encrypt/decrypt functions. Let me first understand the current state and context of this task.

entries.content:
## âœ… Task Completed: Encryption Utility Implementation

**Subtask:** Create encryption utility with AES-256-GCM encrypt/decrypt functions
**Status:** Successfully completed and verified

### What Was Accomplished

The encryption utility was already fully implemented in `packages/server/src/lib/encryption.ts` and I verified its correctness:

#### âœ… **Core Implementation**
- **AES-256-GCM encryption/decryption functions** using Node.js crypto module
- **Secure key derivation** using scrypt with random salts
- **Authentication** via GCM authentication tags
- **Base64 encoding** for safe storage and transmission

#### âœ… **Security Features**
- Random 256-bit salts for key derivation
- Random 128-bit initialization vectors
- 128-bit authentication tags for integrity
- Environment variable configuration (`CCM_ENCRYPTION_KEY`)
- Comprehensive error handling

#### âœ… **Verification Testing**
- Successfully tested encryption/decryption of various text inputs
- Verified Unicode and special character support
- Confirmed built-in test function passes
- All security best practices followed

#### âœ… **Documentation**
- Created verification documentation in `ENCRYPTION_VERIFICATION.md`
- Documented implementation details and test results
- Committed changes with proper message format

### Files Modified/Created
- âœ… `packages/server/src/lib/encryption.ts` (was already implemented)
- âœ… `ENCRYPTION_VERIFICATION.md` (verification documentation)

The encryption utility is now ready for use by the settings service in the next phase of the Auto-Claude integration.
I'll start by checking the build progress and implementation plan to understand the current status of this subtask.

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 2_1 Completed: Create Encryption Utility

I have successfully completed the implementation of the encrypt/decrypt functions using Node.js crypto module with AES-256-GCM. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ” **Encryption Implementation Features:**
- **AES-256-GCM encryption/decryption** with Node.js crypto module
- **Secure key derivation** using scrypt with random salt generation
- **Authentication tags** for integrity verification
- **Random IV generation** for each encryption operation
- **Base64 encoding** for storage and transmission compatibility
- **Environment variable** for encryption key (CCM_ENCRYPTION_KEY)
- **Comprehensive error handling** with descriptive messages

### ğŸ› ï¸ **Utility Functions:**
- `encrypt(plaintext: string)` - Encrypts data with AES-256-GCM
- `decrypt(encryptedData: string)` - Decrypts AES-256-GCM data  
- `isEncrypted(value: string)` - Heuristic check for encrypted strings
- `testEncryption()` - Built-in validation function

### ğŸ“ **Files Updated:**
- âœ… `packages/server/src/lib/encryption.ts` - Complete implementation
- âœ… Implementation plan - Status marked as "completed" 
- âœ… Build progress - Updated with completion details

### ğŸ¯ **Quality Standards Met:**
- âœ… Follows industry best practices for AES-256-GCM encryption
- âœ… No console.log/debug statements
- âœ… Comprehensive error handling
- âœ… Full JSDoc documentation
- âœ… Clean commits with descriptive messages

### ğŸ“Š **Progress Update:**
- **Phase 1**: Schema & Types (Foundation) - **6/6 Complete âœ…**
- **Phase 2**: Settings Infrastructure - **1/4 Complete ğŸš§**

### ğŸš€ **Ready for Next Step:**
**Subtask 2_2**: Implement settings service (depends on this encryption utility) âœ…

The encryption utility provides a secure foundation for the Auto-Claude integration's credential management system and is ready for use by the settings service layer.
I'll help you implement the service layer for settings CRUD with automatic encryption. Let me start by understanding the context and existing patterns.

1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```

   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;
   239â†’  electronMcpEnabled: boolean;
   240â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: boolean;
   241â†’  graphitiEnabled: boolean;
   242â†’
   243â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   244â†’  agentMcpOverrides?: {
   245â†’    [agentType: string]: {
   246â†’      add?: string[];
   247â†’      remove?: string[];
   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file
   271â†’
   272â†’---
   273â†’
   274â†’## Database Schema
   275â†’
   276â†’### New Models
   277â†’
   278â†’**Settings Table:**
   279â†’```prisma
   280â†’model Settings {
   281â†’  id        String   @id @default(cuid())

   284â†’  encrypted Boolean  @default(false)

   286â†’  updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt
   287â†’}
   288â†’```
   289â†’
   290â†’**Settings Keys:**
   291â†’- `autoClaudeBackendPath`: Path to Auto-Claude installation
   292â†’- `linearApiKey`: (encrypted) Linear API key
   293â†’- `l

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 2_2 Complete: Settings Service Layer with Automatic Encryption

I have successfully implemented the settings service layer with automatic encryption for sensitive keys. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ”§ **Implementation Highlights**

**Core Features:**
- **Full CRUD Operations**: `getSetting()`, `setSetting()`, `getSettings()`, `setSettings()`, `deleteSetting()`, `deleteSettings()`
- **Automatic Encryption**: Detects and encrypts sensitive keys (API keys, tokens, passwords, secrets)
- **Smart Key Detection**: Pattern-based identification of sensitive data
- **Batch Operations**: Transaction-supported bulk operations
- **Validation**: Zod schema validation for all inputs

**Utility Functions:**
- `hasSetting()` - Check if setting exists
- `getSettingKeys()` - List all setting keys with optional filtering
- `upgradeSettingToEncrypted()` - Migration support
- `validateEncryptedSettings()` - Health check for encrypted data

**Security Features:**
- Uses existing AES-256-GCM encryption utility
- Automatic encryption for keys containing: `apikey`, `token`, `password`, `secret`, etc.
- Non-sensitive settings remain unencrypted for performance
- Secure decryption with error handling

### ğŸ“ **Files Created**
- `packages/server/src/lib/settings.ts` - Main service implementation

### ğŸ”„ **Quality Checklist Verified**
- âœ… Follows patterns from reference files (database service patterns)
- âœ… No console.log debugging statements (uses proper error throwing)
- âœ… Comprehensive error handling with Zod validation
- âœ… Clean commit with descriptive message
- âœ… Implementation plan updated

### ğŸš€ **Next Steps**
Ready to proceed with **Subtask 2_3**: Create settings API routes that will use this service layer to implement GET/PUT/DELETE endpoints with encryption handling.

The service layer is now available for use by API routes and provides a solid foundation for secure credential management across the Auto-Claude integration.
I'll help you implement the GET/PUT/DELETE /api/settings endpoints with encryption handling. Let me first understand the current context and requirements.

entries.detail:
1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚
    89â†’â”‚      â”‚  SQLite Database       â”‚    â”‚
    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚
    92â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Settings            â”‚    â”‚
    93â†’â”‚      â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â”‚
    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
    95â†’              â”‚
    96â†’              â”‚ ccm auto-claude sync
    97â†’              â”‚ (one-way generation)
    98â†’              â–¼
    99â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚
   101â†’â”‚  ~/Projects/Auto-Claude/            â”‚
   102â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ apps/backend/prompts/*.md      â”‚
   103â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ [AGENT_CONFIGS from CCM API]   â”‚
   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚
   105â†’â”‚   Per-Project:                      â”‚
   106â†’â”‚  .auto-claude/                      â”‚
   107â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ .env                           â”‚
   108â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ task_metadata.json             â”‚
   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’

entries.content:
## Subtask Completed Successfully! âœ…

I have successfully implemented the **GET/PUT/DELETE /api/settings endpoints with encryption handling** (subtask 2_3). Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

### ğŸ¯ **Main Achievements**

1. **Enhanced Main Settings Route** (`packages/server/src/app/api/settings/route.ts`):
   - Replaced direct Prisma calls with the settings service functions
   - Added support for query parameters:
     - `includeSensitive=true` - Include decrypted sensitive values
     - `keysOnly=true` - Return only setting keys
     - `pattern=string` - Filter keys by pattern
   - Enhanced PUT method to support both single setting and batch updates
   - Added DELETE method for bulk deletion by keys array

2. **Created Individual Key Route** (`packages/server/src/app/api/settings/[key]/route.ts`):
   - **GET** method to retrieve a specific setting by key with automatic decryption
   - **PUT** method to update a specific setting with automatic encryption for sensitive keys
   - **DELETE** method to remove a specific setting with proper 404 handling

3. **Fixed Schema Compatibility Issues**:
   - Updated all `prisma.setting` references to `prisma.settings` across the codebase
   - Fixed compilation errors in seed.ts, settings page, export route, and import route
   - Enhanced settings page to use the settings service instead of direct Prisma calls

### ğŸ” **Security Features**

- **Automatic Encryption**: Sensitive keys (API keys, tokens, passwords) are automatically encrypted
- **Flexible Decryption**: Settings can be retrieved with or without sensitive values decrypted
- **Masked Display**: UI shows `[ENCRYPTED]` for sensitive values when not explicitly requesting decryption

### ğŸ”§ **API Endpoints Created**

#### Collection Endpoints (`/api/settings`)
- **GET** `/api/settings?includeSensitive=false&keysOnly=false&pattern=...`
- **PUT** `/api/settings` (single setting: `{key, value}` or batch: `{key1: value1, key2: value2}`)
- **DELETE** `/api/settings` (batch: `{keys: ["key1", "key2"]}`)

#### Individual Endpoints (`/api/settings/[key]`)
- **GET** `/api/settings/linearApiKey`
- **PUT** `/api/settings/linearApiKey` (`{value: "..."}`)
- **DELETE** `/api/settings/linearApiKey`

### âœ… **Quality Assurance**

- **Build Verification**: Successfully compiled with no errors
- **Error Handling**: Proper HTTP status codes and error messages
- **Validation**: Zod schemas for input validation
- **Response Format**: Consistent JSON responses following codebase patterns
- **Encryption**: Automatic handling based on key patterns (tokens, passwords, API keys)

The implementation is now ready for the next phase of development!
I'll help you implement the settings management page with masked credential inputs and validation. Let me start by understanding the current requirements and existing patterns.

1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚
    89â†’â”‚      â”‚  SQLite Database       â”‚    â”‚
    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚
    92â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Settings            â”‚    â”‚
    93â†’â”‚      â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â”‚
    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
    95â†’              â”‚
    96â†’              â”‚ ccm auto-claude sync
    97â†’              â”‚ (one-way generation)
    98â†’              â–¼
    99â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚
   101â†’â”‚  ~/Projects/Auto-Claude/            â”‚
   102â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ apps/backend/prompts/*.md      â”‚
   103â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ [AGENT_CONFIGS from CCM API]   â”‚
   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚
   105â†’â”‚   Per-Project:                      â”‚
   106â†’â”‚  .auto-claude/                      â”‚
   107â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ .env                           â”‚
   108â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ task_metadata.json             â”‚
   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;
   239â†’  electronMcpEnabled: boolean;
   240â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: boolean;
   241â†’  graphitiEnabled: boolean;
   242â†’
   243â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   244â†’  agentMcpOverrides?: {
   245â†’    [agentType: string]: {
   246â†’      add?: string[];
   247â†’      remove?: string[];
   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file
   271â†’
   272â†’---
   273â†’
   274â†’## Database Schema
   275â†’
   276â†’### New Models
   277â†’
   278â†’**Settings Table:**
   279â†’```prisma
   280â†’model Settings {
   281â†’  id        String   @id @default(cuid())
   282â†’  key       String   @unique
   283â†’  value     String   // JSON or plain text
   284â†’  encrypted Boolean  @default(false)
   285â†’  createdAt DateTime @default(now())

## âœ… Subtask Implementation Complete

I have successfully implemented **subtask 2_4: "Build settings management page with masked credential inputs and validation"** from the Settings Infrastructure phase.

### ğŸ¯ What Was Implemented

**1. MaskedInput Component** (`packages/server/src/app/settings/components/masked-input.tsx`)
- Sensitive credential input with show/hide toggle using Eye/EyeOff icons
- Displays encrypted values as masked dots (`â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢`)
- Shows helpful text when values are encrypted

1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚
    89â†’â”‚      â”‚  SQLite Database       â”‚    â”‚
    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚
    92â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Settings            â”‚    â”‚
    93â†’â”‚      â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â”‚
    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
    95â†’              â”‚
    96â†’              â”‚ ccm auto-claude sync
    97â†’              â”‚ (one-way generation)
    98â†’              â–¼
    99â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚
   101â†’â”‚  ~/Projects/Auto-Claude/            â”‚
   102â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ apps/backend/prompts/*.md      â”‚
   103â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ [AGENT_CONFIGS from CCM API]   â”‚
   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚
   105â†’â”‚   Per-Project:                      â”‚
   106â†’â”‚  .auto-claude/                      â”‚
   107â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ .env                           â”‚
   108â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ task_metadata.json             â”‚
   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {

   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}

Perfect! I have successfully completed the subtask for generating .auto-claude/.env files with MCP toggles, API keys, and custom servers.

## Summary

âœ… **Successfully implemented** the `env-file.ts` generator with the following features:

### Core Functions
- **`generateAutoClaudeEnv()`** - Main function that generates comprehensive .env content including:
  - MCP server toggles (Context7, Linear, Electron, Puppeteer, Graphiti)  
  - API keys (Anthropic, Linear, GitHub, Graphiti) with proper integration
  - Custom MCP server configurations with type-specific parameters
  - Agent-specific MCP overrides for fine-grained control
  - Development and debugging settings

- **`validateAutoClaudeEnv()`** - Validation function with robust error checking:
  - Required variable validation (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)
  - Consistency checks between enabled features and API keys
  - Custom validation rules for different integration types

- **`getDefaultAutoClaudeProjectConfig()`** - Helper for sensible defaults

### Key Features
âœ… Follows existing generator patterns from the codebase  
âœ… Proper integration with settings service for encrypted credentials  
âœ… Comprehensive error handling and validation  
âœ… Clean, well-documented code with section headers  
âœ… Support for all AutoClaudeProjectConfig options  
âœ… Correct import paths using `@ccm/shared` package  

### Verification
âœ… Basic functionality verified  
âœ… File structure and exports validated  
âœ… Changes committed with descriptive commit message  
âœ… Discovery recorded for future reference  

The env-file generator is now ready and will produce properly formatted `.auto-claude/.env` files that can be used with Auto-Claude backend integration, complete with all necessary MCP toggles, API keys, and custom server configurations.
I'll help you implement the subtask for generating .auto-claude/.env with MCP toggles, API keys, and custom servers. Let me start by understanding the current context and requirements.
