   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;

   246â†’      add?: string[];

   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];

   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;

   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’

entries.content:
Perfect! I have successfully completed the subtask "Update main generateProjectFiles function to include Auto-Claude generators". Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## âœ… Task Completed: Auto-Claude Generator Integration

### Changes Made

**Enhanced the main `generateProjectFiles` function** in `packages/server/src/lib/generators/index.ts` with several key improvements:

1. **Always generate task_metadata.json** - Now generates with defaults even when no model profile exists
2. **Improved data extraction** - Enhanced component config parsing with null safety 
3. **Better injection context** - Populated prompt injection context with actual project information
4. **Robust condition checking** - Added clear `hasAutoClaudeComponents` variable
5. **Enhanced error handling** - Added proper fallbacks for missing configuration data

### Technical Implementation

- âœ… Properly mapped component data to generator function interfaces
- âœ… Ensured all generator functions receive correct parameter types  
- âœ… Maintained backward compatibility with existing patterns
- âœ… Added meaningful defaults for missing configuration

### Verification

- âœ… TypeScript build passed successfully (no syntax errors)
- âœ… Code follows established codebase patterns  
- âœ… Implementation matches specification requirements
- âœ… Git commit completed with proper message format
- âœ… Implementation plan updated with completion status

### Files Modified

- `packages/server/src/lib/generators/index.ts` - Main generator integration

The Auto-Claude generators are now fully integrated into the main project file generation workflow. CCM can now generate all required Auto-Claude configuration files (`.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, `prompts/*.md`, and `AGENT_CONFIGS.json`) when Auto-Claude components are present in a project.
I'll help you implement the POST /api/auto-claude/import endpoint. Let me start by understanding the current context and what needs to be implemented.

entries.detail:
1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚

   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚

   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚

   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;
   238â†’  linearMcpEnabled: boolean;
   239â†’  electronMcpEnabled: boolean;
   240â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: boolean;
   241â†’  graphitiEnabled: boolean;
   242â†’
   243â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   244â†’  agentMcpOverrides?: {
   245â†’    [agentType: string]: {
   246â†’      add?: string[];
   247â†’      remove?: string[];
   248â†’    };
   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file

   291â†’- `autoClaudeBackendPath`: Path to Auto-Claude installation

     3â†’/**
     4â†’ * Auto-Claude component validation schemas using Zod

     7â†’/**
     8â†’ * Thinking levels for Auto-Claude agents

    10â†’export const ThinkingLevelSchema = z.enum(['none', 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'ultrathink']);
    11â†’
    12â†’/**
    13â†’ * Claude model types for Auto-Claude
    14â†’ */
    15â†’export const ClaudeModelSchema = z.enum(['opus', 'sonnet', 'haiku']);
    16â†’
    17â†’/**
    18â†’ * MCP server type definitions
    19â†’ */
    20â†’export const McpServerTypeSchema = z.enum(['command', 'http']);
    21â†’
    22â†’/**
    23â†’ * Custom MCP server definition schema
    24â†’ */
    25â†’export const CustomMcpServerSchema = z.object({
    26â†’  id: z.string().min(1, 'ID is required'),
    27â†’  name: z.string().min(1, 'Name is required'),
    28â†’  type: McpServerTypeSchema,
    29â†’  command: z.string().optional(),
    30â†’  args: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    31â†’  url: z.string().url('Must be a valid URL').optional(),
    32â†’  headers: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
    33â†’}).refine((data) => {
    34â†’  // Command type must have command field
    35â†’  if (data.type === 'command' && !data.command) {
    36â†’    return false;
    37â†’  }
    38â†’  // HTTP type must have url field
    39â†’  if (data.type === 'http' && !data.url) {
    40â†’    return false;
    41â†’  }
    42â†’  return true;
    43â†’}, {
    44â†’  message: 'Command type requires command field, HTTP type requires url field',
    45â†’});
    46â†’
    47â†’/**
    48â†’ * Per-agent MCP override configuration schema
    49â†’ */
    50â†’export const AgentMcpOverrideSchema = z.object({
    51â†’  add: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    52â†’  remove: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    53â†’}).refine((data) => {
    54â†’  // At least one of add or remove must be provided
    55â†’  return data.add !== undefined || data.remove !== undefined;
    56â†’}, {
    57â†’  message: 'At least one of add or remove must be specified',
    58â†’});
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Auto-Claude agent configuration schema
    62â†’ * Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration
    63â†’ */
    64â†’export const AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema = z.object({
    65â†’  agentType: z.string()
    66â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    67â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    68â†’  tools: z.array(z.string())
    69â†’    .min(1, 'At least one tool must be specified')
    70â†’    .refine((tools) => {
    71â†’      // Validate known tools
    72â†’      const knownTools = ['Read', 'Write', 'Edit', 'Bash', 'Glob', 'Grep', 'Task', 'WebFetch', 'WebSearch'];
    73â†’      return tools.every(tool => knownTools.includes(tool));
    74â†’    }, {
    75â†’      message: 'All tools must be from the known tools list',
    76â†’    }),
    77â†’  mcpServers: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    78â†’  mcpServersOptional: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    79â†’  autoClaudeTools: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    80â†’  thinkingDefault: ThinkingLevelSchema,
    81â†’});
    82â†’
    83â†’/**
    84â†’ * Auto-Claude prompt configuration schema
    85â†’ * Stores agent persona prompts
    86â†’ */
    87â†’export const AutoClaudePromptSchema = z.object({
    88â†’  agentType: z.string()
    89â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    90â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    91â†’  promptContent: z.string()
    92â†’    .min(10, 'Prompt content must be at least 10 characters')
    93â†’    .max(50000, 'Prompt content cannot exceed 50,000 characters'),
    94â†’  injectionPoints: z.object({

    96â†’    projectContext: z.boolean().default(false),
    97â†’    mcpDocumentation: z.boolean().default(false),
    98â†’  }).optional(),
    99â†’});
   100â†’
   101â†’/**
   102â†’ * Auto-Claude model profile schema
   103â†’ * Defines model and thinking configuration per phase
   104â†’ */
   105â†’export const AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema = z.object({
   106â†’  name: z.string()
   107â†’    .min(1, 'Profile name is required')
   108â†’    .max(50, 'Profile name cannot exceed 50 characters')
   109â†’    .regex(/^[a-z0-9_-]+$/, 'Profile name must be lowercase alphanumeric with hyphens/underscores'),
   110â†’  description: z.string()
   111â†’    .min(1, 'Description is required')
   112â†’    .max(500, 'Description cannot exceed 500 characters'),

   165â†’export type AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema>;

   167â†’export type AutoClaudeModelProfileSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema>;

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask Implementation Complete

I have successfully implemented the **POST /api/auto-claude/import** endpoint for parsing existing Auto-Claude configs and creating Component records. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ¯ **Implementation Summary**

**Created:** `packages/server/src/app/api/auto-claude/import/route.ts`

### ğŸ“‹ **Key Features Implemented**

1. **Request Validation**
   - Zod schema for `autoClaudeInstallPath` and optional `dryRun` flag
   - Comprehensive input validation and error handling

2. **Configuration Parsing**
   - **models.py parser**: Extracts AGENT_CONFIGS dictionary using regex matching
   - **prompts/*.md parser**: Reads all markdown files and detects injection points
   - **.auto-claude/.env parser**: Parses environment variables for project configuration
   - **Default model profiles**: Creates balanced, cost-optimized, and quality-focused profiles

3. **Database Integration**
   - Transaction-based Component record creation
   - Support for all Auto-Claude component types:
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG`
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT` 
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE`
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG`
   - Upsert operations to handle existing components gracefully

4. **Advanced Features**
   - **Dry run mode**: Preview import without database changes
   - **Import statistics**: Tracks successful imports and errors
   - **Error collection**: Gathers parsing/validation errors for user feedback
   - **Schema validation**: Uses Auto-Claude Zod schemas for data integrity

### ğŸ”§ **Technical Details**

- **File Structure**: Follows existing API route patterns
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive try/catch with specific error messages
- **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support with proper type annotations
- **Build Verification**: âœ… Passes TypeScript compilation and Next.js build

### ğŸ“¦ **Commit Details**

```bash
git commit: "auto-claude: 4_1 - POST /api/auto-claude/import to parse existing Auto-Claude configs and create Component records"
```

The endpoint is now ready for use and follows all the established patterns and quality standards from the existing codebase. The implementation provides a robust foundation for importing Auto-Claude configurations into the CCM system.
I'll help you implement this subtask. Let me start by understanding the current context and reading the complete file.

entries.content:
Perfect! I have successfully completed the subtask for implementing the POST `/api/auto-claude/import` endpoint. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## âœ… Subtask Completed: POST /api/auto-claude/import endpoint

**Implementation Summary:**

The endpoint is fully implemented with comprehensive functionality:

1. **Auto-Claude Configuration Parsing**:
   - Parses `models.py` files to extract agent configurations
   - Processes `prompts/*.md` files to extract agent prompts with injection point detection
   - Reads `.env` files for project configuration settings
   - Generates default model profiles (balanced, cost-optimized, quality-focused)

2. **Component Record Creation**:
   - Creates Component records in the database using transactions
   - Supports all Auto-Claude component types: `AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG`, `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT`, `AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE`, `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG`
   - Uses upsert operations to handle existing components

3. **Validation & Error Handling**:
   - Validates all imported data using Zod schemas
   - Comprehensive error handling with detailed error messages
   - Graceful handling of missing or malformed files

4. **Additional Features**:
   - Dry-run mode for previewing imports without committing to database
   - Detailed import statistics and error reporting
   - Transaction-based operations for data integrity

**Quality Verification:**
- âœ… TypeScript compilation successful
- âœ… Next.js build completed without errors  
- âœ… API route properly registered and accessible
- âœ… Follows existing codebase patterns and conventions
- âœ… No console.log debugging statements
- âœ… Comprehensive error handling implemented
- âœ… Clean commit with descriptive message

The implementation is production-ready and ready for integration with the Import Wizard in the next phase of development.
I'll start by reading the implementation plan and context to understand the exact requirements for this subtask.

entries.content:
The implementation for the Auto-Claude import route is already complete! Let me provide a summary of what has been verified:

## âœ… Subtask 4_1: POST /api/auto-claude/import endpoint is COMPLETE

### Implementation Verification:

1. **âœ… Endpoint Implementation**: The route is fully implemented at `packages/server/src/app/api/auto-claude/import/route.ts`

2. **âœ… Core Functionality**: 
   - Parses existing Auto-Claude configs from:
     - `models.py` file (extracts AGENT_CONFIGS)
     - `prompts/` directory (reads all .md files)
     - `.auto-claude/.env` file (project configuration)
   - Creates Component records in the database with proper types:
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG`
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT` 
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE`
     - `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG`

3. **âœ… Robust Implementation**:
   - Transaction-based imports for data consistency
   - Zod schema validation for all imported data
   - Proper error handling and rollback on failures
   - Dry-run mode support for previewing imports
   - Comprehensive statistics reporting
   - Upsert pattern to handle existing components

4. **âœ… Build Verification**: TypeScript compilation passes successfully

5. **âœ… Git History**: Previous commits show this was completed:
   - `4a274c9`: "auto-claude: 4_1 - POST /api/auto-claude/import to parse existing Auto-Claude configs and create Component records"
   - `f2906f8`: "auto-claude: API Routes Phase - POST /api/auto-claude/import endpoint completed"

The implementation follows all the established patterns from the codebase, includes proper validation using the Auto-Claude schemas, and creates Component records exactly as specified in the subtask requirements.

## Summary

**Subtask 4_1 is fully implemented and functional.** The POST /api/auto-claude/import endpoint successfully:
- âœ… Parses existing Auto-Claude configurations
- âœ… Creates proper Component records in the database  
- âœ… Follows codebase patterns and best practices
- âœ… Includes comprehensive error handling and validation
- âœ… Builds without TypeScript errors

The implementation is ready for use and meets all requirements specified in the subtask description.
I'll start by reading the implementation plan and understanding the current state of the project.

1â†’import { z } from 'zod';
     2â†’
     3â†’/**
     4â†’ * Auto-Claude component validation schemas using Zod
     5â†’ */
     6â†’
     7â†’/**
     8â†’ * Thinking levels for Auto-Claude agents
     9â†’ */
    10â†’export const ThinkingLevelSchema = z.enum(['none', 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'ultrathink']);
    11â†’
    12â†’/**
    13â†’ * Claude model types for Auto-Claude
    14â†’ */
    15â†’export const ClaudeModelSchema = z.enum(['opus', 'sonnet', 'haiku']);
    16â†’
    17â†’/**
    18â†’ * MCP server type definitions
    19â†’ */
    20â†’export const McpServerTypeSchema = z.enum(['command', 'http']);
    21â†’
    22â†’/**
    23â†’ * Custom MCP server definition schema
    24â†’ */
    25â†’export const CustomMcpServerSchema = z.object({
    26â†’  id: z.string().min(1, 'ID is required'),
    27â†’  name: z.string().min(1, 'Name is required'),
    28â†’  type: McpServerTypeSchema,
    29â†’  command: z.string().optional(),
    30â†’  args: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    31â†’  url: z.string().url('Must be a valid URL').optional(),
    32â†’  headers: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
    33â†’}).refine((data) => {
    34â†’  // Command type must have command field
    35â†’  if (data.type === 'command' && !data.command) {
    36â†’    return false;
    37â†’  }
    38â†’  // HTTP type must have url field
    39â†’  if (data.type === 'http' && !data.url) {
    40â†’    return false;
    41â†’  }
    42â†’  return true;
    43â†’}, {
    44â†’  message: 'Command type requires command field, HTTP type requires url field',
    45â†’});
    46â†’
    47â†’/**
    48â†’ * Per-agent MCP override configuration schema
    49â†’ */
    50â†’export const AgentMcpOverrideSchema = z.object({
    51â†’  add: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    52â†’  remove: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    53â†’}).refine((data) => {
    54â†’  // At least one of add or remove must be provided
    55â†’  return data.add !== undefined || data.remove !== undefined;
    56â†’}, {
    57â†’  message: 'At least one of add or remove must be specified',
    58â†’});
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Auto-Claude agent configuration schema
    62â†’ * Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration
    63â†’ */
    64â†’export const AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema = z.object({
    65â†’  agentType: z.string()
    66â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    67â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    68â†’  tools: z.array(z.string())
    69â†’    .min(1, 'At least one tool must be specified')
    70â†’    .refine((tools) => {
    71â†’      // Validate known tools
    72â†’      const knownTools = ['Read', 'Write', 'Edit', 'Bash', 'Glob', 'Grep', 'Task', 'WebFetch', 'WebSearch'];
    73â†’      return tools.every(tool => knownTools.includes(tool));
    74â†’    }, {
    75â†’      message: 'All tools must be from the known tools list',
    76â†’    }),
    77â†’  mcpServers: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    78â†’  mcpServersOptional: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    79â†’  autoClaudeTools: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    80â†’  thinkingDefault: ThinkingLevelSchema,
    81â†’});
    82â†’
    83â†’/**
    84â†’ * Auto-Claude prompt configuration schema
    85â†’ * Stores agent persona prompts
    86â†’ */
    87â†’export const AutoClaudePromptSchema = z.object({
    88â†’  agentType: z.string()
    89â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    90â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    91â†’  promptContent: z.string()
    92â†’    .min(10, 'Prompt content must be at least 10 characters')
    93â†’    .max(50000, 'Prompt content cannot exceed 50,000 characters'),
    94â†’  injectionPoints: z.object({
    95â†’    specDirectory: z.boolean().default(false),
    96â†’    projectContext: z.boolean().default(false),
    97â†’    mcpDocumentation: z.boolean().default(false),
    98â†’  }).optional(),
    99â†’});
   100â†’
   101â†’/**
   102â†’ * Auto-Claude model profile schema
   103â†’ * Defines model and thinking configuration per phase
   104â†’ */
   105â†’export const AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema = z.object({
   106â†’  name: z.string()
   107â†’    .min(1, 'Profile name is required')
   108â†’    .max(50, 'Profile name cannot exceed 50 characters')
   109â†’    .regex(/^[a-z0-9_-]+$/, 'Profile name must be lowercase alphanumeric with hyphens/underscores'),
   110â†’  description: z.string()
   111â†’    .min(1, 'Description is required')
   112â†’    .max(500, 'Description cannot exceed 500 characters'),
   113â†’  phaseModels: z.object({
   114â†’    spec: ClaudeModelSchema,
   115â†’    planning: ClaudeModelSchema,
   116â†’    coding: ClaudeModelSchema,
   117â†’    qa: ClaudeModelSchema,
   118â†’  }),
   119â†’  phaseThinking: z.object({
   120â†’    spec: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   121â†’    planning: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   122â†’    coding: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   123â†’    qa: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   124â†’  }),
   125â†’});
   126â†’
   127â†’/**
   128â†’ * Auto-Claude project configuration schema
   129â†’ * Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings
   130â†’ */
   131â†’export const AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchema = z.object({
   132â†’  // MCP toggles
   133â†’  context7Enabled: z.boolean().default(true),
   134â†’  linearMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   135â†’  electronMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   136â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   137â†’  graphitiEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   138â†’
   139â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   140â†’  agentMcpOverrides: z.record(z.string(), AgentMcpOverrideSchema).optional(),
   141â†’
   142â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   143â†’  customMcpServers: z.array(CustomMcpServerSchema).default([]),
   144â†’
   145â†’  // Integration settings (encrypted when stored)
   146â†’  linearApiKey: z.string().optional(),
   147â†’  linearTeamId: z.string().optional(),
   148â†’  githubToken: z.string().optional(),
   149â†’  githubRepo: z.string()
   150â†’    .regex(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+$/, 'GitHub repo must be in format "owner/repo"')
   151â†’    .optional(),
   152â†’}).refine((data) => {
   153â†’  // If linear is enabled, require API key and team ID
   154â†’  if (data.linearMcpEnabled && (!data.linearApiKey || !data.linearTeamId)) {
   155â†’    return false;
   156â†’  }
   157â†’  return true;
   158â†’}, {
   159â†’  message: 'Linear MCP requires both API key and team ID when enabled',
   160â†’});
   161â†’
   162â†’/**
   163â†’ * Type inference helpers
   164â†’ */
   165â†’export type AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema>;
   166â†’export type AutoClaudePromptSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudePromptSchema>;
   167â†’export type AutoClaudeModelProfileSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema>;
   168â†’export type AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchema>;
   169â†’export type CustomMcpServerSchemaType = z.infer<typeof CustomMcpServerSchema>;
   170â†’export type AgentMcpOverrideSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AgentMcpOverrideSchema>;

- Creates Component records with proper Auto-Claude component types
- Supports upsert operations to avoid duplicates
- Comprehensive error handling with detailed statistics

entries.detail:
1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚
    89â†’â”‚      â”‚  SQLite Database       â”‚    â”‚
    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚

   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚

   111â†’

   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**

   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files

   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools

   137â†’}

entries.content:
## Task Completed Successfully! âœ…

I have successfully implemented the **POST /api/auto-claude/sync** endpoint that writes agent configs and prompts to the Auto-Claude backend. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ“ Files Created/Modified
- **`packages/server/src/app/api/auto-claude/sync/route.ts`** - New sync endpoint implementation

### ğŸš€ Key Features Implemented

**1. Request Validation**
- Optional `backendPath` override parameter
- Optional `projectId` for specific project sync
- `dryRun` flag for preview without file writes
- Comprehensive input validation using Zod schemas

**2. Configuration Management**
- Retrieves Auto-Claude backend path from settings (`autoClaudeBackendPath`)
- Supports request-level path override
- Validates Auto-Claude installation integrity

**3. Database Integration**
- Fetches enabled `AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT` and `AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG` components
- Parses JSON configurations into typed objects
- Comprehensive error handling for malformed configs

**4. File Generation**
- Uses Auto-Claude generators for prompts and agent configs
- Generates `prompts/*.md` files with injection point replacement
- Creates `agent_configs.json` in Auto-Claude format
- Supports injection context for dynamic content

**5. File System Operations**
- Creates backup files before overwriting existing ones
- Ensures directory structure exists (creates if missing)
- Writes files to correct Auto-Claude backend locations:
  - `apps/backend/prompts/*.md`
  - `agent_configs.json` (root level)

**6. Project Management**
- Updates `lastAutoClaudeSync` timestamp for projects
- Supports both project-specific and bulk updates
- Safe handling of timestamp update failures

**7. Response Handling**
- Detailed sync statistics (files written, counts, errors)
- Dry-run mode returns preview without file modifications
- Comprehensive error reporting with actionable messages
- Multi-status responses for partial success scenarios

### âœ… Quality Assurance

**TypeScript Compilation**: âœ… Passed successfully
**Build Verification**: âœ… Route appears in Next.js build output
**Code Patterns**: âœ… Follows existing API route patterns
**Error Handling**: âœ… Comprehensive error cases covered
**Documentation**: âœ… Well-documented with inline comments

### ğŸ”„ API Usage Examples

**Basic Sync:**
```bash
POST /api/auto-claude/sync
Content-Type: application/json
{}
```

**Dry Run Preview:**
```bash
POST /api/auto-claude/sync
Content-Type: application/json
{
  "dryRun": true
}
```

**Custom Backend Path:**
```bash
POST /api/auto-claude/sync
Content-Type: application/json
{
  "backendPath": "/custom/path/to/auto-claude"
}
```

### ğŸ“Š Sync Response Format
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "stats": {
    "promptsWritten": 5,
    "agentConfigsWritten": 1,
    "filesWritten": ["prompts/coder.md", "prompts/planner.md", "agent_configs.json"],
    "errors": []
  },
  "backendPath": "/path/to/auto-claude"
}
```

The implementation is now ready for the next phase of development and fully integrates with the existing Auto-Claude generator system. All changes have been committed with descriptive commit messages following the project conventions.

entries.content: Excellent! I have successfully completed the subtask. Let me record this achievement:

## âœ… Subtask 4_2 Completed Successfully

**POST /api/auto-claude/sync endpoint** has been successfully implemented and verified!

### ğŸ¯ What Was Accomplished

The sync endpoint is fully functional with comprehensive features:

- **Schema Validation**: Zod-based request validation for `backendPath`, `projectId`, and `dryRun` parameters
- **Backend Path Management**: Configuration from settings with override support and path existence validation
- **Auto-Claude Installation Verification**: Checks for proper `apps/backend` directory structure
- **Database Integration**: Extracts AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT and AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG components
- **File Generation**: Uses generator functions with automatic backup support
- **Dry-Run Support**: Preview mode without writing files
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive error responses with proper HTTP status codes
- **Database Updates**: Automatic sync timestamp tracking for projects

### âœ… Verification Results

- **Build Check**: âœ… TypeScript compilation successful
- **Runtime Test**: âœ… Endpoint responds correctly to requests
- **Input Validation**: âœ… Proper error messages for invalid inputs
- **Path Validation**: âœ… Correctly validates backend path configuration

### ğŸ“ Status Updated

- Subtask 4_2 marked as **completed** in implementation_plan.json
- Discovery recorded in session memory for future reference

The sync endpoint is now ready for integration with the Auto-Claude ecosystem and can be used to write agent configurations and prompts to Auto-Claude backend installations.

     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’

   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration

   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript

   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];

1â†’import { z } from 'zod';
     2â†’
     3â†’/**
     4â†’ * Auto-Claude component validation schemas using Zod
     5â†’ */
     6â†’
     7â†’/**
     8â†’ * Thinking levels for Auto-Claude agents
     9â†’ */
    10â†’export const ThinkingLevelSchema = z.enum(['none', 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'ultrathink']);
    11â†’
    12â†’/**
    13â†’ * Claude model types for Auto-Claude
    14â†’ */
    15â†’export const ClaudeModelSchema = z.enum(['opus', 'sonnet', 'haiku']);
    16â†’
    17â†’/**
    18â†’ * MCP server type definitions
    19â†’ */
    20â†’export const McpServerTypeSchema = z.enum(['command', 'http']);
    21â†’
    22â†’/**
    23â†’ * Custom MCP server definition schema
    24â†’ */
    25â†’export const CustomMcpServerSchema = z.object({
    26â†’  id: z.string().min(1, 'ID is required'),
    27â†’  name: z.string().min(1, 'Name is required'),
    28â†’  type: McpServerTypeSchema,
    29â†’  command: z.string().optional(),
    30â†’  args: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    31â†’  url: z.string().url('Must be a valid URL').optional(),
    32â†’  headers: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
    33â†’}).refine((data) => {
    34â†’  // Command type must have command field
    35â†’  if (data.type === 'command' && !data.command) {
    36â†’    return false;
    37â†’  }
    38â†’  // HTTP type must have url field
    39â†’  if (data.type === 'http' && !data.url) {
    40â†’    return false;
    41â†’  }
    42â†’  return true;
    43â†’}, {

    45â†’});
    46â†’
    47â†’/**
    48â†’ * Per-agent MCP override configuration schema
    49â†’ */
    50â†’export const AgentMcpOverrideSchema = z.object({
    51â†’  add: z.array(z.string()).optional(),

    53â†’}).refine((data) => {
    54â†’  // At least one of add or remove must be provided

    56â†’}, {

    58â†’});
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Auto-Claude agent configuration schema
    62â†’ * Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration
    63â†’ */

    66â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')

## âœ… Task Completed Successfully!

I have successfully implemented the GET/PUT /api/auto-claude/agents endpoints for agent config management. Here's what was accomplished:

### ğŸ“ Files Created
- `packages/server/src/app/api/auto-claude/agents/route.ts`
- `packages/server/src/app/api/auto-claude/agents/[agentType]/route.ts`

### ğŸš€ Implementation Features

**Main Agents Route (`/api/auto-claude/agents`):**
- **GET**: Lists all agent configurations with tool/MCP matrix visualization
- **POST**: Creates new agent configurations with validation

**Individual Agent Route (`/api/auto-claude/agents/[agentType]`):**
- **GET**: Retrieves specific agent configuration
- **PUT**: Updates specific agent configuration (partial updates supported)
- **DELETE**: Removes specific agent configuration

### ğŸ”§ Key Technical Features
- âœ… **Comprehensive validation** using Auto-Claude Zod schemas
- âœ… **Proper error handling** with appropriate HTTP status codes
- âœ… **Database integration** using Component model with type 'AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG'
- âœ… **Tool/MCP matrix visualization** for frontend consumption
- âœ… **Query filtering** by agentType
- âœ… **Statistics and metadata** in responses
- âœ… **Consistent patterns** following existing codebase conventions

git commit -m "auto-claude: unknown - GET/PUT /api/auto-claude/agents endpoints for agen"

1â†’# Spec: CCM + Auto-Claude Integration
     2â†’
     3â†’**Spec ID:** 001-ccm-auto-claude-integration
     4â†’**Created:** 2026-01-05
     5â†’**Complexity:** Complex
     6â†’**Estimated Effort:** 9 phases, 72 subtasks
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’
    10â†’## Executive Summary
    11â†’
    12â†’Extend Claude Code Config Manager (CCM) to become the **single source of truth** for both Claude Code and Auto-Claude configurations. This integration enables centralized management of agent personas, MCP servers, model profiles, and project settings across multiple machines through a unified CLI and web UI.
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Deliverables
    15â†’
    16â†’1. **New Component Types**: Auto-Claude primitives (agent configs, prompts, model profiles, project configs)
    17â†’2. **Settings Infrastructure**: Secure credential management with encryption
    18â†’3. **Generators**: Automatic generation of `.auto-claude/.env`, `task_metadata.json`, and `prompts/*.md`
    19â†’4. **API Routes**: Full CRUD operations for Auto-Claude components
    20â†’5. **Import Wizard**: One-time migration from existing Auto-Claude installations
    21â†’6. **CLI Commands**: `ccm auto-claude` command group for sync and management
    22â†’7. **Web UI**: Dashboard, agent config editor, prompt editor, model profile manager
    23â†’8. **Seed Data**: Default prompts, agent configs, and model profiles
    24â†’9. **Integration Testing**: End-to-end validation of the complete workflow
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Problem Statement
    29â†’
    30â†’### Current Pain Points
    31â†’
    32â†’**Fragmented Configuration Management:**
    33â†’- Claude Code configs managed separately from Auto-Claude configs
    34â†’- Manual sync required between machines
    35â†’- No centralized editing or version control
    36â†’- Duplicate configuration definitions
    37â†’
    38â†’**Auto-Claude Configuration Complexity:**
    39â†’- Agent configs scattered across Python code (`models.py`)
    40â†’- Prompt files require manual editing
    41â†’- Model profiles hardcoded or environment-dependent
    42â†’- No visual tooling for configuration management
    43â†’
    44â†’**Limited Discoverability:**
    45â†’- Hard to know which agents have which tools
    46â†’- MCP server dependencies not clearly documented
    47â†’- Model/thinking profiles buried in code
    48â†’
    49â†’### Success Criteria
    50â†’
    51â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: All configurations managed through CCM database
    52â†’2. **One-Way Sync**: CCM â†’ Auto-Claude (CCM is authoritative)
    53â†’3. **Import Once**: Migrate existing configs with import wizard
    54â†’4. **Visual Editing**: Web UI for all configuration types
    55â†’5. **CLI Access**: Full feature parity between web and CLI
    56â†’6. **Safe Defaults**: Production-ready seed data included
    57â†’
    58â†’---
    59â†’
    60â†’## Architecture Overview
    61â†’
    62â†’### Current State
    63â†’
    64â†’**CCM** manages Claude Code primitives:
    65â†’- MCP Servers â†’ `.mcp.json`
    66â†’- Subagents â†’ `.claude/agents/*.md`
    67â†’- Skills â†’ `.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md`
    68â†’- Commands â†’ `.claude/commands/*.md`
    69â†’- Hooks â†’ `.claude/settings.json`
    70â†’- CLAUDE.md templates
    71â†’
    72â†’**Auto-Claude** has separate configuration:
    73â†’- Agent configs (tools + MCP access per agent type)
    74â†’- Agent prompts (`apps/backend/prompts/*.md`)
    75â†’- Project configs (`.auto-claude/.env`)
    76â†’- MCP server definitions (built-in + custom)
    77â†’- Model/thinking profiles per phase
    78â†’
    79â†’### Target State
    80â†’
    81â†’```
    82â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    83â†’â”‚   CCM (Single Source of Truth)     â”‚
    84â†’â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
    85â†’â”‚  â”‚  Web UI      â”‚  â”‚  CLI Tool   â”‚ â”‚
    86â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
    87â†’â”‚           â”‚              â”‚          â”‚
    88â†’â”‚      â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”‚
    89â†’â”‚      â”‚  SQLite Database       â”‚    â”‚
    90â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Components          â”‚    â”‚
    91â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Profiles            â”‚    â”‚
    92â†’â”‚      â”‚  - Settings            â”‚    â”‚
    93â†’â”‚      â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â”‚
    94â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
    95â†’              â”‚
    96â†’              â”‚ ccm auto-claude sync
    97â†’              â”‚ (one-way generation)
    98â†’              â–¼
    99â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   100â†’â”‚   Auto-Claude Backend               â”‚
   101â†’â”‚  ~/Projects/Auto-Claude/            â”‚
   102â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ apps/backend/prompts/*.md      â”‚
   103â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ [AGENT_CONFIGS from CCM API]   â”‚
   104â†’â”‚                                     â”‚
   105â†’â”‚   Per-Project:                      â”‚
   106â†’â”‚  .auto-claude/                      â”‚
   107â†’â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ .env                           â”‚
   108â†’â”‚  â””â”€â”€ task_metadata.json             â”‚
   109â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   110â†’```
   111â†’
   112â†’### Sync Strategy
   113â†’
   114â†’**One-Way Sync (CCM â†’ Auto-Claude):**
   115â†’- CCM database is authoritative
   116â†’- `ccm auto-claude sync` generates and writes files
   117â†’- Direct edits in Auto-Claude files will be overwritten
   118â†’- Import wizard exists only for initial migration
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Component Types
   123â†’
   124â†’### 1. AUTO_CLAUDE_AGENT_CONFIG
   125â†’
   126â†’Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration.
   127â†’
   128â†’**Schema:**
   129â†’```typescript
   130â†’interface AutoClaudeAgentConfig {
   131â†’  agentType: string;              // e.g., "coder", "planner", "qa_reviewer"
   132â†’  tools: string[];                // ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"]
   133â†’  mcpServers: string[];           // Required MCP servers
   134â†’  mcpServersOptional: string[];   // Conditional MCP servers
   135â†’  autoClaudeTools: string[];      // Custom auto-claude tools
   136â†’  thinkingDefault: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   137â†’}
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’**Output:** JSON export for Auto-Claude's AGENT_CONFIGS registry
   141â†’
   142â†’**Example:**
   143â†’```json
   144â†’{
   145â†’  "agentType": "coder",
   146â†’  "tools": ["Read", "Write", "Edit", "Bash", "Glob", "Grep"],
   147â†’  "mcpServers": ["context7"],
   148â†’  "mcpServersOptional": ["linear", "graphiti"],
   149â†’  "autoClaudeTools": ["parallel_shell"],
   150â†’  "thinkingDefault": "medium"
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’### 2. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROMPT
   155â†’
   156â†’Stores agent persona prompts.
   157â†’
   158â†’**Schema:**
   159â†’```typescript
   160â†’interface AutoClaudePrompt {
   161â†’  agentType: string;              // Matches agent config
   162â†’  promptContent: string;          // Full markdown content
   163â†’  injectionPoints?: {             // Dynamic content markers
   164â†’    specDirectory: boolean;
   165â†’    projectContext: boolean;
   166â†’    mcpDocumentation: boolean;
   167â†’  };
   168â†’}
   169â†’```
   170â†’
   171â†’**Output:** `prompts/{agentType}.md` in Auto-Claude backend
   172â†’
   173â†’**Example:**
   174â†’```markdown
   175â†’# Coder Agent
   176â†’
   177â†’You are the implementation specialist...
   178â†’
   179â†’{{specDirectory}} - Current spec directory
   180â†’{{projectContext}} - Project analysis results
   181â†’```
   182â†’
   183â†’### 3. AUTO_CLAUDE_MODEL_PROFILE
   184â†’
   185â†’Defines model and thinking configuration per phase.
   186â†’
   187â†’**Schema:**
   188â†’```typescript
   189â†’interface AutoClaudeModelProfile {
   190â†’  name: string;  // e.g., "cost-optimized", "quality-focused"
   191â†’  description: string;
   192â†’  phaseModels: {
   193â†’    spec: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   194â†’    planning: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   195â†’    coding: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   196â†’    qa: "opus" | "sonnet" | "haiku";
   197â†’  };
   198â†’  phaseThinking: {
   199â†’    spec: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   200â†’    planning: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   201â†’    coding: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   202â†’    qa: "none" | "low" | "medium" | "high" | "ultrathink";
   203â†’  };
   204â†’}
   205â†’```
   206â†’
   207â†’**Output:** `task_metadata.json` defaults or `.auto-claude/.env` overrides
   208â†’
   209â†’**Example:**
   210â†’```json
   211â†’{
   212â†’  "name": "balanced",
   213â†’  "description": "Default balanced configuration",
   214â†’  "phaseModels": {
   215â†’    "spec": "sonnet",
   216â†’    "planning": "sonnet",
   217â†’    "coding": "sonnet",
   218â†’    "qa": "sonnet"
   219â†’  },
   220â†’  "phaseThinking": {
   221â†’    "spec": "medium",
   222â†’    "planning": "high",
   223â†’    "coding": "medium",
   224â†’    "qa": "high"
   225â†’  }
   226â†’}
   227â†’```
   228â†’
   229â†’### 4. AUTO_CLAUDE_PROJECT_CONFIG
   230â†’
   231â†’Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings.
   232â†’
   233â†’**Schema:**
   234â†’```typescript
   235â†’interface AutoClaudeProjectConfig {
   236â†’  // MCP toggles
   237â†’  context7Enabled: boolean;

   247â†’      remove?: string[];

   249â†’  };
   250â†’
   251â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   252â†’  customMcpServers?: Array<{
   253â†’    id: string;
   254â†’    name: string;
   255â†’    type: "command" | "http";
   256â†’    command?: string;
   257â†’    args?: string[];
   258â†’    url?: string;
   259â†’    headers?: Record<string, string>;
   260â†’  }>;
   261â†’
   262â†’  // Integration settings
   263â†’  linearApiKey?: string;
   264â†’  linearTeamId?: string;
   265â†’  githubToken?: string;
   266â†’  githubRepo?: string;
   267â†’}
   268â†’```
   269â†’
   270â†’**Output:** `.auto-claude/.env` file

1â†’import { z } from 'zod';
     2â†’
     3â†’/**
     4â†’ * Auto-Claude component validation schemas using Zod
     5â†’ */
     6â†’
     7â†’/**
     8â†’ * Thinking levels for Auto-Claude agents
     9â†’ */
    10â†’export const ThinkingLevelSchema = z.enum(['none', 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'ultrathink']);
    11â†’
    12â†’/**
    13â†’ * Claude model types for Auto-Claude
    14â†’ */
    15â†’export const ClaudeModelSchema = z.enum(['opus', 'sonnet', 'haiku']);
    16â†’
    17â†’/**
    18â†’ * MCP server type definitions
    19â†’ */
    20â†’export const McpServerTypeSchema = z.enum(['command', 'http']);
    21â†’
    22â†’/**
    23â†’ * Custom MCP server definition schema
    24â†’ */
    25â†’export const CustomMcpServerSchema = z.object({
    26â†’  id: z.string().min(1, 'ID is required'),
    27â†’  name: z.string().min(1, 'Name is required'),
    28â†’  type: McpServerTypeSchema,
    29â†’  command: z.string().optional(),
    30â†’  args: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    31â†’  url: z.string().url('Must be a valid URL').optional(),
    32â†’  headers: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
    33â†’}).refine((data) => {
    34â†’  // Command type must have command field
    35â†’  if (data.type === 'command' && !data.command) {
    36â†’    return false;
    37â†’  }
    38â†’  // HTTP type must have url field
    39â†’  if (data.type === 'http' && !data.url) {
    40â†’    return false;
    41â†’  }
    42â†’  return true;
    43â†’}, {
    44â†’  message: 'Command type requires command field, HTTP type requires url field',
    45â†’});
    46â†’
    47â†’/**
    48â†’ * Per-agent MCP override configuration schema
    49â†’ */
    50â†’export const AgentMcpOverrideSchema = z.object({
    51â†’  add: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    52â†’  remove: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
    53â†’}).refine((data) => {
    54â†’  // At least one of add or remove must be provided
    55â†’  return data.add !== undefined || data.remove !== undefined;
    56â†’}, {
    57â†’  message: 'At least one of add or remove must be specified',
    58â†’});
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Auto-Claude agent configuration schema
    62â†’ * Defines per-agent tool and MCP access configuration
    63â†’ */
    64â†’export const AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema = z.object({
    65â†’  agentType: z.string()
    66â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    67â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    68â†’  tools: z.array(z.string())
    69â†’    .min(1, 'At least one tool must be specified')
    70â†’    .refine((tools) => {
    71â†’      // Validate known tools
    72â†’      const knownTools = ['Read', 'Write', 'Edit', 'Bash', 'Glob', 'Grep', 'Task', 'WebFetch', 'WebSearch'];
    73â†’      return tools.every(tool => knownTools.includes(tool));
    74â†’    }, {
    75â†’      message: 'All tools must be from the known tools list',
    76â†’    }),
    77â†’  mcpServers: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    78â†’  mcpServersOptional: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    79â†’  autoClaudeTools: z.array(z.string()).default([]),
    80â†’  thinkingDefault: ThinkingLevelSchema,
    81â†’});
    82â†’
    83â†’/**
    84â†’ * Auto-Claude prompt configuration schema
    85â†’ * Stores agent persona prompts
    86â†’ */
    87â†’export const AutoClaudePromptSchema = z.object({
    88â†’  agentType: z.string()
    89â†’    .min(1, 'Agent type is required')
    90â†’    .regex(/^[a-z_]+$/, 'Agent type must be lowercase with underscores only'),
    91â†’  promptContent: z.string()
    92â†’    .min(10, 'Prompt content must be at least 10 characters')
    93â†’    .max(50000, 'Prompt content cannot exceed 50,000 characters'),
    94â†’  injectionPoints: z.object({
    95â†’    specDirectory: z.boolean().default(false),
    96â†’    projectContext: z.boolean().default(false),
    97â†’    mcpDocumentation: z.boolean().default(false),
    98â†’  }).optional(),
    99â†’});
   100â†’
   101â†’/**
   102â†’ * Auto-Claude model profile schema
   103â†’ * Defines model and thinking configuration per phase
   104â†’ */
   105â†’export const AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema = z.object({
   106â†’  name: z.string()
   107â†’    .min(1, 'Profile name is required')
   108â†’    .max(50, 'Profile name cannot exceed 50 characters')
   109â†’    .regex(/^[a-z0-9_-]+$/, 'Profile name must be lowercase alphanumeric with hyphens/underscores'),
   110â†’  description: z.string()
   111â†’    .min(1, 'Description is required')
   112â†’    .max(500, 'Description cannot exceed 500 characters'),
   113â†’  phaseModels: z.object({
   114â†’    spec: ClaudeModelSchema,
   115â†’    planning: ClaudeModelSchema,
   116â†’    coding: ClaudeModelSchema,
   117â†’    qa: ClaudeModelSchema,
   118â†’  }),
   119â†’  phaseThinking: z.object({
   120â†’    spec: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   121â†’    planning: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   122â†’    coding: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   123â†’    qa: ThinkingLevelSchema,
   124â†’  }),
   125â†’});
   126â†’
   127â†’/**
   128â†’ * Auto-Claude project configuration schema
   129â†’ * Stores project-level Auto-Claude settings
   130â†’ */
   131â†’export const AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchema = z.object({
   132â†’  // MCP toggles
   133â†’  context7Enabled: z.boolean().default(true),
   134â†’  linearMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   135â†’  electronMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   136â†’  puppeteerMcpEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   137â†’  graphitiEnabled: z.boolean().default(false),
   138â†’
   139â†’  // Per-agent MCP overrides
   140â†’  agentMcpOverrides: z.record(z.string(), AgentMcpOverrideSchema).optional(),
   141â†’
   142â†’  // Custom MCP servers
   143â†’  customMcpServers: z.array(CustomMcpServerSchema).default([]),
   144â†’
   145â†’  // Integration settings (encrypted when stored)
   146â†’  linearApiKey: z.string().optional(),
   147â†’  linearTeamId: z.string().optional(),
   148â†’  githubToken: z.string().optional(),
   149â†’  githubRepo: z.string()
   150â†’    .regex(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+$/, 'GitHub repo must be in format "owner/repo"')
   151â†’    .optional(),
   152â†’}).refine((data) => {
   153â†’  // If linear is enabled, require API key and team ID
   154â†’  if (data.linearMcpEnabled && (!data.linearApiKey || !data.linearTeamId)) {
   155â†’    return false;
   156â†’  }
   157â†’  return true;
   158â†’}, {
   159â†’  message: 'Linear MCP requires both API key and team ID when enabled',
   160â†’});
   161â†’
   162â†’/**
   163â†’ * Type inference helpers
   164â†’ */
   165â†’export type AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeAgentConfigSchema>;
   166â†’export type AutoClaudePromptSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudePromptSchema>;
   167â†’export type AutoClaudeModelProfileSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeModelProfileSchema>;
   168â†’export type AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AutoClaudeProjectConfigSchema>;
   169â†’export type CustomMcpServerSchemaType = z.infer<typeof CustomMcpServerSchema>;
   170â†’export type AgentMcpOverrideSchemaType = z.infer<typeof AgentMcpOverrideSchema>;
